intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium discessum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its yellow flowers bloom from June to September, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium discessum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
